str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

word: whom I love and long for,
str2: Longed for, missed, greatly desired. From epi and a derivative of the latter part of epipotheo; yearned upon, i.e. Greatly loved.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To stand fast, stand firm, persevere. From the perfect tense of histemi; to be stationary, i.e. to persevere.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
